article.headline: Rackspace stock rallies on report of Amazon interest in stake
article.body: Rackspace Technology Inc. RXT, -1.99% shares rallied Monday following a report that Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +3.01% was in early talks to invest in the cloud-technology services company. Rackspace shares jumped as much as 19% in early trading and were last up 11% at $18.44. On Monday, Reuters reported that Amazon was looking to acquire a minority stake in Rackspace. The company re-emerged as a publicly traded one earlier in the month and shares dropped 22% on their first day. Rackspace is 65% owned by Apollo Global Management Inc. APO, -0.85%, which acquired the company for $4.3 billion back in 2016.. Apollo shares were last up 2.5% at $48.55.
